chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kenneth W. Wilk was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Must seek and maintain full-time employment

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo AODA and any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges.  To commence FORTHWITH but, no later than 3:00 p.m. today.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth W. Wilk

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth W. Wilk in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Counts 2 & 3: Dismissed

Count 1: 

24 months Probation
$1,819.00 Fine/Costs fees,  (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS)  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan - BOND APPLY
$25 blood draw cost, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan
6 months in Sauk County Jail, with huber.  Commence FORTHWITH but, no later than 3:00 p.m. TODAY
29 days jail credit, if probation revoked
Provide DNA surcharge/sample
36 months Driver License revocation
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
36 month Ignition Interlock-Upon Licensure
Absolute sobriety
No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any place that the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
Seek and maintain full-time employment
No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid D/L.

Paperwork handed in court.
